## 2. Exploratory Data Analysis

### 2.1 Check the data type
    
We need to check the datatype of the data attributes from the given dataset. It is the most fundamental step to any data preparation and transformation steps that we are going to perform in the following sections. 

![Data%20Attributes1.png](attachment:Data%20Attributes1.png)

Excluding the car name, we can observe that there are 5 continuous data, 1 discrete data and 2 categorical data.

In this problem, our objective is to predict the **MPG(Miles Per Gallon)** of the car. So MPG will be our target variable(Y) and all other variables are independent variables(X).

# Auto-MPG Fuel Consumption Prediction

## Overview

This dataset was taken from the `StatLib library` which is maintained at `Carnegie Mellon University`. The dataset was used in the 1983 American Statistical Association Exposition.

The source of the dataset is [here](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Auto+MPG).
